content.raw:
From Google Code Issue #12

**Imported Labels**: enhancement, imported, Priority-Medium

_From [orion.bu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/117805126661095974338/) on February 24, 2010 18:05:14_

Currently, if a Genomedata archive is opened with mode="r+" in Python,
genomedata-close-data must be called on the archive from the shell before
it can be re-opened in Python.

Additionally, the dirty bit is set on all chromosomes opened from a
mode="r+" Genome object, regardless if they are changed or not (i.e. all
are opened with mode="r+" when calling Genome.tracknames_continuous).

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/genomedata/issues/detail?id=12_
content.html:
From Google Code Issue #12

Imported Labels: enhancement, imported, Priority-Medium

From orion.bu...@gmail.com on February 24, 2010 18:05:14

Currently, if a Genomedata archive is opened with mode="r+" in Python, genomedata-close-data must be called on the archive from the shell before it can be re-opened in Python.

Additionally, the dirty bit is set on all chromosomes opened from a mode="r+" Genome object, regardless if they are changed or not (i.e. all are opened with mode="r+" when calling Genome.tracknames_continuous).

Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/genomedata/issues/detail?id=12
